title: Calories in Fried Potato
meta_description: Discover calories in potato fried per 100g, including carbs, fat, protein, and nutrition breakdowns with tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Pan-fried or deep-fried in vegetable oil; medium russet potato; lightly salted; no sauces or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, oil used, frying method, portion size, and added seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of fried potato has about 312 kcal, with high carbs from the potato and fat from frying oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g fried potato?
faqs.a: Approximately 312 kcal for 100g of fried potato.

faqs.q: What are the macros in fried potatoes?
Are fried potatoes high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, mainly from frying oilâ€”about 14.8g fat per 100g.

faqs.q: How does frying affect potato calories?
faqs.a: Frying adds oil, increasing calories from ~77 kcal (baked) to 312 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: Can I make fried potatoes healthier?
faqs.a: Yes, use air-frying or oven-baking to cut ~150-200 kcal per 100g.
